Posts.Content: PurpleMinion wrote: I searched for an appropriate thread to talk about this but decided to just start my own. I am so freaked out right now. I was diagnosed with IBC less than a year ago and no treatments have worked. I have had a lot of progression over the last few months, including some internal lymph nodes and bones, many bones. Last week I had some MRIs to evaluate the bones better and as a result of those, this week I will be having MORE MRIs and a spinal tap because on one of the MRIs there is something they can't tell what it is, but see the title of this thread. I am aware that leptomeningeal disease is really bad and has a pretty poor prognosis. I am scared. Has anyone had a scare like this that turned out to be something else? Or, has anyone had LM and had any kind of longer term survival? I want to see my daughter graduate from high school in two years, and right now I am having a hard time believing that will happen. I am taking a "board break" mid June 2016, I will be back but mentally exhausted right now. Peace be with all of you. Diagnosed at 46 triple negative IBC. Mets to skin, lungs, bones. Dx 6/29/2015, IBC, Right, Stage IIIB, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2- Chemotherapy 7/21/2015 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxol (paclitaxel) Chemotherapy 10/22/2015 CEF Dx 1/7/2016, IBC, Right, Stage IV, metastasized to other, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2- Targeted Therapy 2/4/2016 Dx 5/6/2016, Stage IV, metastasized to bone Chemotherapy 5/9/2016 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Gemzar (gemcitabine) Dx Stage IV, metastasized to lungs Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: "cannot rule out LM tumor" PurpleMinion PurpleMinion

Posts.Content: PurpleMinion wrote: Has anyone heard from Anna? Many of her latest posts went away when Bon's threads did but I know she was here a few weeks ago. She was in the hospital and was set to be released either to home or to a rehab. I PM'd her and didn't get a response, I am worried. I am taking a "board break" mid June 2016, I will be back but mentally exhausted right now. Peace be with all of you. Diagnosed at 46 triple negative IBC. Mets to skin, lungs, bones. Posts.Content: PurpleMinion wrote: Please sign, nobody wants to have MBC but we all have the potential to face it - this petition asks for research: https://petitions.whitehouse.gov/petition/add-meta... I am taking a "board break" mid June 2016, I will be back but mentally exhausted right now. Peace be with all of you. Diagnosed at 46 triple negative IBC. Mets to skin, lungs, bones.
